title: Syncing to an encrypted Seafile library stops after 1 hour
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
When syncing files with the Seafile backend to an encrypted library the sync just stops with error messages after 1 hour. Encrypted libraries in Seafile are only decrypted in a web browser for 1 hour until you need to input the encrypted password again, seems like this unfortunately also affects rclone.

https://help.seafile.com/security_and_encryption/use_encrypted_libraries/
- If you use web app, you have to input the password to the server. The server will cache the password in encrypted format for 1 hour. It won't store the password on disk.

I haven't found out a way to increase this 1 hour limit on the Seafile server-side, except not using an encrypted library. However I want to use an encrypted library to transfer my files into.

Anyhow, after exactly an hours of successfully syncing files without any issues (except a few one-byte-off transfers, which are probably fixed by re-sync if the sync didn't stop after 1 hour), the following errors show up after about 1 minute timeout for every file still not transferred:
```
Dec 30 10:48:52 rclone rclone[56954]: file1: Failed to copy: internal server error during file upload
Dec 30 10:49:02 rclone rclone[56954]: file2: Failed to copy: internal server error during file upload
```

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
# rclone --version
rclone v1.59.2-DEV
- os/version: freebsd 13.1-release-p2 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 13.1-release-p2 (amd64)
- os/type: freebsd
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.19.2
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
```
FreeBSD 13.1-RELEASE-p5, in an iocage jail on TrueNAS-13.0-U3
```

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
```
Seafile backend
```

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
rclone --config=/usr/local/etc/rclone.conf --transfers 8 --stats-log-level NOTICE --syslog --ignore-case --exclude "thumbnails/**" --delete-excluded sync /mnt/SOURCE/ rclone-seafile:
```


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
Dec 30 10:48:52 rclone rclone[56954]: file1: Failed to copy: internal server error during file upload
Dec 30 10:49:02 rclone rclone[56954]: file2: Failed to copy: internal server error during file upload
```
